result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PAY restitution in the amount of $6,860.00 payable to the victim, Eva M.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
*12/4/2017  Restitution Order received from DOC signed.  Payable amended to Stephen M. son of victim.

AS TO EACH COUNT: PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 3, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete a job training program or a vocational program to enhance ability to obtain employment.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Thomas Mealey

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629, and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Ave, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm

Order amending judgment of conviction.
Pursuant to Sec 973.01, WI Stats. MATTHEW T. MEALEY (DOB. 07-28-1989) was sentenced to a bifurcated sentence.
Pursuant to Sec. 302.05(3)(c), WI Stats., within 30 days after the court has been notified that the defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program, the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of the Confinement Time not served will be added to the Extended Supervision portion of the sentence.  The total length of the sentence will not change.
Whereas, MATTHEW T. MEALEY entered and began participation in the Earned Release Program on 09-03-2018.
Whereas, MATTHEW T. MEALEY has successfully completed the Earned Release Program on 01-18-2019.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
Paperwork forwarded to the Clerk of Court's Office to amend the judgment of conviction.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18, Judge Colon.  jm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT1:   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count 3, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS, concurrent to Count 1, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Complete a job training program or a vocational program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $6,860.00 payable to the victim, Eva M.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered the Repeater penalty enhancer stricken as to Count #1 and Count #3.

**Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
with attached Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey not in court, in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 05-06-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Eva M.; Thomas M.; Pamela M or their residences

Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Matthew Thomas Mealey in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
